content.prompt: The urbanization and growth of the steel producing centers of the Ruhr Valley in Germany and Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, in the United States can best be explained by the site characteristics of

choices.label: large, local supplies of iron ore and intersecting railroads
large, local supplies of coal and intersecting rivers
large, local supplies of food and intersecting highways
large, local supplies of skilled labor and seaports
large, local supplies of educated workers and university growth poles

unit.text: 6: Cities and Urban Land-Use Patterns and Processes

topic.text: 6.1: The Origin and Influences of Urbanization

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain the significance of geographic similarities and differences among different locations and/or at different times.
